result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ricardo Mendoza-Flores

records.addlTxt: Court orders previous conditions to remain in full force and effect.
Case in court for bail bond hearing. Arguments heard as to bail. Court adjusts cash bail down to $ 7,500.00. All other non-monetary conditions to remain.

Defendant Ricardo Mendoza-Flores appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael G. Levine in court for Ricardo Mendoza-Flores.  Attorney Abby Rockendorf appeared in court on behalf of Amy E Spanczak for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court  for Arraignment. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. 
Defense requests a status conference date.  Case adjourned to Br 16.
Status conference scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Defendant's Motion for Reduction of Bail
Received and Signed. ORDER PERMITTING ACCESS TO DISCOVERY MATERIALS
Received and Filed. Proposed Order Permitting Access to Discovery

Defendant Ricardo Mendoza-Flores in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Moran for Michael G. Levine in court for Ricardo Mendoza-Flores.  Attorney Amy E Spanczak in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Arraignment.  Court is advised of co-Defendant case, 22CF2327, wherein Request for Substitution of Judge has been filed.  Defense requests substitution in this case so both cases can follow each other.  Discussion held.  Court consented to substitution.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Brittany Grayson, Br. 16.
Arraignment scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael G. Levine in court, defendant Ricardo Mendoza-Flores not in court, in custody.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court for Arraignment hearing.  Defense has filed a Motion for Substitution of Judge.  Court is advised that there is a Co-Defendant case awaiting preliminary hearing.  Defense requests adjournment. No objection from State. Defense waives the time limit for arraignment hearing. 
Matter adjourned to Br. 9.  Arraignment scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael G. Levine in court, defendant Ricardo Mendoza-Flores not in court, in custody.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Case set for arraignment in Branch 17.   Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Arraignment scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ricardo Mendoza-Flores in court with Attorney Michael G. Levine; both appear by video.  Defendant Ricardo Mendoza-Flores in custody.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Greenfield Officer A. Sustachek. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading. Defense requests to be heard on bail on the next date and for an arraignment date. Bail review will be heard in Br. 4 Judge Hanrahan for Br. 17.    
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Request for Substitution of Judge.  Received and Filed.  nk
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report.  Received and Filed.  nk

Adjustment Number: 22A 060820,
Payable Number: 1016683,
Receipt Number: 22RP026413,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Ricardo Mendoza-Flores not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Ricardo Mendoza-Flores in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Ricardo Mendoza-Flores in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ricardo Mendoza-Flores appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. DNA Required. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
